dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod was. (her voice chills) He was with Ratan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? (no answer) What does he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He deals in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Kristen safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let's get a plane for San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DETECTIVE BURROWS walks back into his office. Mast, sitti on the edge of the desk, is waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently your friend has gone into  Mexico. A Border Guard responded to  the APB. How does it feel to have  the L.A.P.D. doing your work for  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to thank me for this.  You know what the media's like. They  love this kinda shit. If that guy  goes off half-cocked and gets himself  hurt, you're going to have so much  bad publicity, you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I heard you the first time. We had  nothing to go on with this kid. Just  a runaway. (a beat) Do you really think he's in danger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he has anything to say about it,  yeah. I've been asking a lot of  questions and I don't like the answers  I'm getting. He's made a lot of people  nervous, including some poor faggot  who thought he was going to be a  movie star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We aren't gonna arrest him for that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Big threat. TV would ream you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep me informed of what he's up to.  You help me, I'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mast nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Why don't people stay where they  belong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake and Niki sit in a line of multi-colored plexi-glass  chairs in the Western Terminal of the airport. Niki munch a pack of Chuckles while Jake, his elbows on his knees, l at the floor. Niki prattles on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what your problem is? You're  a very negative person. You think  negatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake tries to ignore her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You have to believe in something.  What do they believe in -- the  Whatjamacillit church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christian Reformed. It's a Dutch  Calvinist denomination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they believe in reincarnation? I  believe in reincarnation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They believe in the 'TULIP.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the crap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) It's an anagram. It comes from the  Canons of Dort. Every letter stands  for a different belief. T-U-L-I-P.  Like -- are you sure you're interested  in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T stands for Total depravity, that  is, all men, through original sin,  are totally evil and incapable of  good. 'All my works are like filthy  rags in the sight of the Lord.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is charmed. He's never been called upon to explain h beliefs to someone so totally ignorant of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be that as it may. U is for  Unconditional Election. God has chosen  a certain number of people to be  saved, The Elect, and He has chosen  them from the beginning of time. L  is for Limited Atonement. Only a  limited number will be atoned, will  go to Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can stop if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INTERCOM ANNOUNCES a flight: Jake listens for a momen It's a flight to Mexico City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I is for Irresistible Grace. God's  grace cannot be resisted or denied.  And P is for the Perseverance of the  Saints. Once you are in Grace you  cannot fall from the number of the  elect. And that's the 'TULIP.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait. I'm trying to figure  this out. This is like Rona Barrett.  Before you become saved, God already  knows who you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to. That's Predestination. If  God is omniscient, if He knows  everything -- and He wouldn't be God  if He didn't -- then He must have  known, even before the creation of  the world, the names of those who  would be saved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's already worked out. The fix  is in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More or less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Then why be good? Either you're  saved or you ain't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of gratitude for being chosen.  That's where Grace comes in. God  first chooses you, then allows you,  by Grace, to choose Him of your own  free will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) You really believe all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (shrugs) Well, mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll admit it's confusing from the  outside. You've got to see it from  the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you see anything from the inside  it makes sense. You ought to hear  perverts talk. A guy once almost had  me convinced to let his dachshund  fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not quite the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make any sense to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INTERCOM ANNOUNCES Western Flight #601 to San Francis They rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's rental car pulls into a San Francisco Travel Lodge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki places a call from a phone booth. Jake watches the  passing denizens of North Beach. The familiar sordid tableau is played out before his eyes massage parlors, peep shows, strip joints, sex shops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hangs up phone) Tod'll meet you at the bookstore at  Eddy and O'Farrell tomorrow noon. I  told him you were a 'specialty'  customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't I meet him now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki, cocky, walks next to Jake. She is in her element. S calls out to a pimp:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope your prick falls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, surprised, turns away from the pimp's cold stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't I meet him now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki brazenly calls out to a strutting hooker:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rot in hell, honey. (to Jake) He's busy now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does he live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second. It's my ass I'm  risking. You better do it my way.  These fuckers don't mess around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki walks off. Jake follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's rental car is parked outside his motel room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake sits on the edge of his bed, studying the crease in trousers. His shirt is partiallly open. Niki, swigging a Coke sits squatted atop the built in des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have been in more motel rooms  this week than in the rest of my  life. At least it feels that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean. After a while  they all look the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you live in a house back in  wherever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand Rapids? Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your own land?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Just you and your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Look, I really don't know your  daughter but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't expect too much. I mean  about her coming back. Once a girl  gets into the life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing the subject) You wife isn't dead is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Dorn surprised, turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a guess. She ain't dead though  is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake shakes his head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) She left you right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (a beat) She was the one called Joanne. How'd  you find that out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a guess. Did you have it good  with your wife? You know, sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake resents Niki's forwardness: what business of hers is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame you, Niki. Really I  don't. It's this culture, where  everything's based on sex, sold on  sex... (starts to get angry) ...magazines, music, TV. It's  destroying everything. Buy this 'cause  of sex, use this 'cause of sex. Kids  think it's normal. They think they're  supposed to talk dirty, wear scanty  clothes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Don't get upset. I lied too. I don't  make no five hundred dollars a week.  Everything I make goes to Granville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Granville?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My man. 'Pimp.' I split 'cause he  don't treat me for shit. Thinks he's  so cool 'cause he's black. I once  tried to take my clothes but he says,  'You can't take 'em 'cause they're  my clothes -- I bought 'em.' Yeah,  with my fucking money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake doesn't want to get involved with Niki's problems:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Niki, this really isn't my  business. I don't know anything  about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess we're both fucked, huh?  But at least you get to go to heaven.  I don't get shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORBELL RINGS. Jake, suspicious, walks over to the w and peeks out. Seeing someone he recognizes, he opens the door. Andy Mast, woebegone and wrinkled as usual, stands at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Niki  knowingly) This is just how you found me once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake slips outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt like such a shit, pilgrim,  after what I did to you -- not that  I did anything wrong -- that I kept  investigating, poking around. There's  some poor s.o.b. in L.A. with his  face all bent out of shape who you've  damaged his movie career. Lucky for  him, people don't look at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do the police want to arrest me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. They don't care about some faggot  hustler. They're more interested in  your daughter's health -- and yours.  Like I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelieving) Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, pilgrim, you're way out on a  limb here. You don't know what you're  into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure as hell haven't been any  help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about that. Have you found  anything out? You've got to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell me something for  a change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is Ratan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mast pales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you hear that name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just heard. Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mast walks toward the swimming pool. Mast looks at the still, blue surface of the pool. Jake s beside him. A tourist passes by with his two sons. Mast  thinks, then speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's possible to buy  anything on this earth. You can buy  child whores, slaves. You can have  people raped, killed... (a beat) One of the men who supposedly arranges  such things is named Ratan. He usually  isn't in this country. (a beat) How'd you hear about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything more. I'll find  out what I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding toward motel) Does she know anything about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? The whore? No. She's just a  victim. A dime a dozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake sleeps in his Travel Lodge bed. A jagged shard of blue light plays across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stands at the corner, then turns and enters the porn bookstore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks around. Seeing no one he recognizes, he pays his admission fee wa down a rack, picks up a copy of "Hot Twat," pages through it. It's been over a week since Jake first stepped into a por bookstore. The change in his manner is striking. He now s at ease in the endless night-world of pandering and  pornography. A few moments later, a long-haired man steps up behind hi The young man is wearing red alligator boots and a silver and turquoise belt -- like the man in "Slave of Love." To scrutinizes Jake a moment before speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Hey, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake turns. Tod gives him some skin. Tod seems unattracti at first, but the longer one looks at him, the more oddly sensual he appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I hear you got money to spend. (as Jake nods) I hear you're interested in...  interesting things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you work for the San Francisco  Police Department, or do you have  any other affiliation with any law  enforcement agency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to meet Ratan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backs off) What is that? A kind of chair? I  never heard of no Ratan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying Tod) I was told that there were certain  things that only Ratan could provide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about real excitement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I heard you and Ratan just  came from Mexico. And that you had a  film of a girl being, ah you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know no Ratan, but I may be  able to help you out. It's not me,  of course. Just helping out a friend.  It'll cost you five hundred bucks  for a single screening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this with a girl named Kristen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Um-hm. You got the five hundred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it or leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me here today at seven o'clock.  With the money. Then we'll go see  the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod puts his hand on Jake's shoulder and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't gonna ever have no thrill  like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki sits on a bed watching a syndicated sitcom and munch a Taco Bell enchilada. She hears a CAR pull up and a man's FOOTSTEPS walks to th door. She cautiously gets up to see who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake walks out of Pandora's Books behind Tod. They turn t corner and walk out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake and Tod enter the "Hot Pink" massage parlor. A sign the front door reads: "Sex/Intercourse/Here."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod leads Jake past two girls into the back of the parlor Tod smiles to one of the parlor girls and touches the oth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod ushers Jake into a barren "office" in the rear of the parlor. A sheet has been tacked up at one end of the office. Acro the room, the projectionist, a boy about 15, stands next a battered old 16mm silent projector. Two other men sit in the darkened room. One looks middle- aged and decadent; the other, about 26, wears jeans, a we shirt, and a beat up flight jacket. He's saved up several years for this. Jake sits in an empty office chair next to the other men. Tod nods to the boy and he starts up the projector. A gra black and white image appears on the screen. The projectionist punches a cheap cassette player which e scratchy Mexican fiesta music through the room. It's clear why the projectionist has chosen a Latin sound track: the film is set up in a Tijuana flophouse. On screen, a girl with long blonde hair and Kristen's bui sits on the edge of a barren double bed. She wears jeans a shirt. Her face is covered by a black leather mask. The eye slits are taped shut. A Cerveza poster of a half-naked Mexican girl hangs on th wall behind her. A young Mexican, stripped to the waist, walks over to the girl. Taking instructions from someone off camera, he sta to undress her. The girl, unable to see her seducer, nevertheless submits his desires. Jake watches the screen from the shadows. The pale images flicker across a metal filing cabinet behind him. Tod sli out of the room. On screen, the young Mexican has finished the girl. He tu to the director for further instructions. A man wearing a white suit walks into the frame. He flash a stiletto from his sleeve and stabs the young Mexican. T girl, not able to see what is happening, turns her head  quizzically. Jake watches in unbelieving horror. The young man in the  flight jacket is calm and dispassionate. The young Mexican falls to the floor bleeding. The man in the white suit bends down and wipes the stiletto on the  Mexican's pant leg. The man in the white suit steps over to the girl and puts one hand under her mask. He lifts his stiletto again. He  rips off the mask from the girl's face; it is not Kristen Jake is relieved. The faces of the others are full of  anticipation. Jake's relief turns to horror at what he now sees. Blurre images reflect against the metal cabinet behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mast, waiting for Jake, talks to Niki. The TV still plays the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Granville's looking for  you, Niki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name ain't Niki. It's Pattica,  like in Attica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Granville's looking for you anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arrogant) Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy who bought you that ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he can just fuck himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls off her ring and starts to hand it to Mast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it, honey. You're gonna need  it. I know that boy. He can make  life real tough for a working girl.  He'll string you out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gestures to his veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can fuck off, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taking a big chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't ever gonna see him again  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no? What you gonna do? Get a job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki, sullen, looks away. Then, defensive, she says what  she's been thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake'll take care of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Van Dorn? You must be kidding  yourself, honey. You think once that  guy finds his daughter he'll care  about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki looks away again. A car pulls in front of the motel room. They both turn to the door. Jake, weary and angry, walks in out of the night. Ignorin Mast, he takes Niki by the arm and leads her out of earsh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Mast moves to overhear them, Jake turns and edges hi toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, pilgrim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forceful) Just leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm here to help you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake ushers Mast out the door and chains it. Mast waits  outside as Jake returns to Niki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find out where she was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod gave me the slip. I have to find  him again. Where does he live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing something is  wrong) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking Niki gently by the shoulder, Jake sits her on the  edge of the bed. He speaks in a calm, forceful, parental  tone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Niki. My daughter's been  missing five months. I've gone through  a lot to find out what's happened to  her. I just saw a girl killed. I  will not let Tod slip out of my hands.  You have to tell me where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then you'll forget about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insistent) Where is he, Niki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake starts to raise his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relents) Try a place called the House of  Bondage. It's a plain black storefront  next to Jane's. There are some  apartments in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stands up and, taking Niki's head in his hands, kiss her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't forget you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake turns and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake passes Mast and heads for his car. Mast restrains hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, pilgrim? Where  are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake tries to push his way past Mast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let me take care of this. I don't  want you to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pushes Mast aside. Mast continues to talk as Jake op his car door and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't do anything until the police  get there. Don't hurt that girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake turns his car and takes off. Mast hurries back into motel room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mast heads immediately for the phone, talking to Niki as goes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to tell me where he's  going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mast sits down and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hello, police? My name's Mast. Get  me Joe Klein in Vice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mast turns to Niki:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; tough) You don't know that man. He'll hurt  his own fucking daughter. I've got  to stop him. (a beat) You know about Ratan, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki looks on in fear and confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Dorn walks down the garish neon strip past "Jane's  Pleasure House" to an unmarked black storefront. The door open. A light shines on a sign reading: "387 OPEN." He walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jake steps through the barred black door, he is hit wi a wave of familiar smells: Human sweat, blood and sexual  fluids. The House of Bondage specializes in the three "discipline bondage, dominance and humiliation. It has four dominatio rooms, each decorated in a different decor -- Babylonian, Medieval, Louis Quatorze, prison motifs -- to satisfy a  variety of tastes. Two dominants, dressed in black satin pants and shirts, s on the sofa. HOPE, wearing a black silver-studded collar, walks over to Jake. Her voice is hard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. You want some information?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We offer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the disciplines: bondage,  domination and humiliation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Tod. Is he in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know no Tod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What girls you got here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Hope. This is Faith. (gestures to girl on  sofa) Charity's in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you got, three girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, how many girls do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was told there was a real nice  girl here named Joanne. Quite young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Charity. She's out back. She'll  be free in half hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pushes her aside. The girls watch with surprise as Jake marches through the curtain toward the rear of the parlor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake steps down the corridor. A customer emerges from a r and passes him. He slides open one door: the Medieval Dungeon is empty. H continues on. He passes the Louis Quatorze Room. It, too, is empty. Hope calls from behind Jake:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod steps into the corridor in front of Jake. Tod squints recognize the intruder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious) What do you want? (scrutinizes him) Do I know you from somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know where my daughter is.  Her name is Kristen, or Joanne. She's  with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police know about Ratan. They  know he's here with you. They know  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod is taken aback, but tries not to show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Goody for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod starts past Jake, but Jake stretches out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod tries to push past Van Dorn but Jake grabs his arms a tries to twist them. Tod breaks free and Jake smacks him  across his forehead with his open hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You wait here. I'll find out where  she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't goin' nowhere alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is beyond reasoning. Tod looks around for an alterna route of escape. Tod ducks into the Prison Room. Jake follows. Vertical bars cover the grey walls. Handcuffs and chains  hang from the bars. In the center of the room, a Harley  Davidson "Hog" is incongruously mounted, its front wheel  pointed skyward. Leather straps are attached to the  handlebars. Tod skirts the Harley and pushes it toward Jake as he ent The huge 1200-pound machine crashes toward Van Dorn. Jake jumps back as the bike bounces in front of him, then starts for Tod. Lowering his shoulder, Tod smashes through the thin paste wall. Jake, steeping over the motorcycle, pursues. In the Louis Quatorze Room, Jake grabs Tod by the shoulde and spins him around. Tod swings as he turns, hitting Jak Jake grabs Tod's legs as he falls. They both crash through the next pasteboard wall into the Medieval Dungeon. Tod breaks free, runs through the dungeon and bursts thro the last pasteboard wall. Jake pulls himself to his feet follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope and Faith, standing against the wall, watch as Tod a Jake burst through the wall and dash out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake chases Tod out of the House of Bondage. Van Dorn pushes one girl, knocks over another and catches with Tod at the corner. He tackles Tod around the waist, rams him into a building and turns him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Ratan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake grabs the young man by his hair and pulls him down t street. Tod yelps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ratan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing a parking meter, Jake smashes Tod's head into it. Tod's forehead cracks into the glass. Tod, bleeding, protests:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That film was a fake! Everything's  phony...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ratan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Tod doesn't immediately answer, Jake rams his skull  into the next parking meter. Tod, bleeding, dazed, strugg to stay on his feet. Jake pulls him forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I know he's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gripping his hair more tightly, Van Dorn drags him to the next parking meter and smashes his head into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ratan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious bystanders watch Jake smash the youth's bleeding  head into the next parking meter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) Who the fuck knows? The Four Aces.  He goes there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Dorn pulls Tod down the sidewalk toward the Four Aces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Dorn pulls the bleeding Tod into the Four Aces, a low life strip club. A dozen solo patrons are scattered around the dimly lit b On stage, a couple performs a routine sex simulation act a scratchy Barry White record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two police cars, dome lights flashing, pull up in front o the House of Bondage. Mast's car pulls up behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man wearing a white suit sits at a table with several g He immediately recognizes Tod. This is RATAN. The man who killed the young Mexican and girl in the film. Ratan starts to rise. Jake drops Tod and heads toward Rat A girl wearing a skimpy halter stands up between Ratan an Jake. She turns and looks back at Jake: it is Kristen. She is terrified. Kristen turns and runs away, stumbling  over a chair. Ratan rushes toward the front door. In the same instant Jake sees Kristen falling, Ratan flee Trying to get around Jake, Ratan flashes his stiletto for A gash razors across Jake's upper chest. Ratan's stiletto flashes forward: Jake's arm is cut. Jake clasps Ratan and thrusts him backward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street fills with SIRENS, flashing light and police. Mast rushes toward The Four Aces. Niki follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake rams Ratan backward into the smoke-colored front win Ratan's back smashes through the plate glass. Ratan's fee lift off the floor as he falls backward. Sinking backward against the broken glass, Ratan swings h stiletto at Jake. Jake, protecting himself from the knife, flips Ratan over Ratan's chest and stomach rasp across the jagged glass. Jake grabs Ratan's head in both his hands and forces it  downward onto the bottom edge of the jagged window frame. He rubs Ratan's neck across the glass: every artery, vein and capillary rip out of Ratan's neck. Ratan collapses against the window frame. TWO OFFICERS, guns drawn, rush toward Ratan's body. The S Officer pulls out his handcuffs, then realizes it will no be needed. Jake turns and heads toward where he last saw Kristen. The First Officer aims his gun at Jake and calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mast and plainclothes officer (Joe Klein), rush over and  instruct the Officers to ease off. Jake walks across the now empty bar. Several tables are  overturned. Jake walks to the table where Kristen tripped. Following logical path, Jake walks into the women's rest room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen squeezes herself against the yellow rest room wal Trembling, she holds her twisted ankle and looks at her f in fear. Jake takes off his torn coat and drapes it over his daugh shoulders. She tries not to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Kristen. Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing red and yellow lights illuminate the chaos: -- Curious mobs press against police lines. -- Ambulance attendants lift Ratan's body onto a stretche -- The two officers handcuff a bloodied and confused Tod. -- Police officers interview Hope, Faith and other by-  standers. Mast walks over to Jake and Kristen. Niki watches from a  distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another one. Tod. In the  club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mast watches the ambulance attendants cover Ratan's body. Jake leads Kristen to a police car and places her in the  rear seat. Jake sees Niki in the crowd. She is watching Jake and Kri She knows she no longer has a place in his life. He walks over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki, maybe I can... There's probably  some way to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki does what Jake cannot: she breaks the connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ice cold) You got your daughter. I got my money.  So now fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki turns on her heel and walks into the neon darkness. Jake walks back to Mast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, can you do something for her?  Maybe money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, pilgrim. There's nothing  you can do. Forget this place. Start  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake walks back to where his daughter waits for him. The MUSIC turns into an orchestrated version of "Precious Memories."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the MUSIC RISES we DISSOLVE BETWEEN: -- Wes, Anne and Marsha welcome Kristen back in their hom Anne embraces her tearfully. -- Jake, back at work, talks to Mary near the lathes. -- Niki, wearing white vinyl boots and a blonde wig, walk the streets of Los Angeles. -- Kristen lies sleeping peacefully in her bedroom. -- Jake sleeps. Blue light falls across his face. Slowly, burning through his face, the grainy black and wh image of a girl wearing a black mask appears. A hand reac down to pull off the mask. Jake wakes suddenly from his dream, his screaming face do exposed with the terrified young girl's.
